name: Add date of birth field in user registration page
description: Add date of birth field in user registration page
llmTaskExplanation: Add a 'date of birth' field to the user registration page using Next.js for the frontend and Node.js with TypeScript for the backend. This involves updating the user registration form to include a new input field for the date of birth, ensuring it is properly validated and stored in the database. Use any date validation library as needed.
validations: Date of birth must be a valid date.
Date of birth cannot be a future date.
Date of birth must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
Date of birth is a required field.
unitTests: Test that a valid date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD is accepted.
Test that a future date is rejected.
Test that an invalid date format is rejected.
Test that the form submission fails if the date of birth is missing.
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user on the registration page, when they enter a valid date of birth, then the form should accept it.
Given a user on the registration page, when they enter a future date, then the form should display an error message.
Given a user on the registration page, when they enter an invalid date format, then the form should display an error message.
Given a user on the registration page, when they do not enter a date of birth, then the form should display an error message.
technicalDependencies: Date validation library (e.g., moment.js or date-fns) if not already in use.
security: Ensure date of birth input is sanitized to prevent injection attacks.
Consider encrypting the date of birth if stored in the database as it is PII.
performance: Ensure date validation does not significantly impact form submission performance.
businessContext: The date of birth is likely used for age verification or demographic analysis.
otherNotes: Consider adding a tooltip or placeholder text to guide users on the expected date format.

llmAssumptions.assumption: The tech stack includes a frontend framework like React or Angular.
The backend is capable of handling date inputs and storing them in a database.
There is an existing user registration form to modify.
The frontend is using Next.js and the backend is using Node.js with TypeScript.
No existing date validation library is in use, so any library can be used.

inScope: Adding a date of birth field to the user registration form.
Validating the date of birth input.
outOfScope: Modifying any other parts of the user profile.

suggestedFileChanges.rationale: To add the date of birth input field and validation logic.
To implement or update date validation logic.

promptForAider: Add a 'date of birth' field to the user registration page using Next.js for the frontend and Node.js with TypeScript for the backend. Ensure the date is validated (valid date, not in the future, format YYYY-MM-DD) and is a required field. Update the form component and validation logic accordingly. Use any date validation library as needed. Ensure input is sanitized and consider encrypting the date of birth if stored. Test with valid, future, invalid, and missing dates.
